* Provide examples of companies that are successfully implementing these business models and value chains in precision farming
* One business model that is gaining popularity in precision farming is the cooperative model, where farmers join together to share resources and expertise to improve efficiency and profitability. An example of a successful precision farming cooperative is Organic Valley, a cooperative of organic farmers in the United States. (Source: <https://www.organicvalley.coop/>)
* Chart 6: Comparison of Profitability with and without Cooperative Model in Precision Farming
* Another business model that is being used in precision farming is vertical integration, where companies control multiple stages of the value chain. An example of a company successfully implementing this model is BrightFarms, a company that controls the entire value chain from seed to store for their hydroponic produce. (Source: <https://www.brightfarms.com/>)
* Table 4: Comparison of Control in Value Chain with and without Vertical Integration in Precision Farming
* Additionally, contract farming is also being used in precision farming where farmers enter into a contract with a processor or distributor to grow specific crops. An example of a company that uses contract farming is Greenbelt Microgreens, a company that contracts with farmers to grow microgreens for their products. (Source: <https://www.greenbeltmicrogreens.com/>)

VII. Conclusion

* Summarize the key points discussed in the article, highlighting the benefits of precision farming using organic hydroponics in bamboo greenhouses, IoT, and renewable energy for sustainability and circular economy
* Emphasize the potential for precision farming to positively impact local communities and contribute to a sustainable future for agriculture.
